awd_titl_txt: Anisotropy of Magnetic Susceptibility of Welded Ignimbrites
awd_abstract_narration: Anisotrophy of magnetic susceptibility (AMS) is a potentially                   powerful indicator of rock fabric (preferred grain orientation)                 that has not been fully exploited as a tool in volcanology.  This               proposal seeks funds for a much more detailed investigation of                  AMS fabrics in welded ignimbrites than has been attempted in                    previous studies.  Very carefully selected sites will be sampled                in order to evaluate the origin and nature of AMS fabrics in                    welded tuffs, to map out primary flow directions on the scale of                tens to hundreds of meters, to assess the effect that secondary                 processes (welding and rheomorphism) have on these primary                      fabrics, and to assess the degree to which AMS can be used to                   constrain mechanisms of deposition from pyroclastic flows.  The                 Bandelier Tuff, Jemez Mountains, New Mexico will be studied.
